result.execSummary:
The defendant David Arroyo-Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin (<=3g) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School, Use of a Dangerous Weapon, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for 96 days.

superMiscConds.notes: AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept of Corrections, but to include:
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Random urine screens.  No positive results. No illegal drugs. No controlled substances without valid prescription. No contact with drug community.
Seek and maintain full time employment. Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

supervisions.notes: **10/7/2015  Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving two and a half (2 1/2) years of Total Confinment time in this case.

BOTH CTS:  Court ordered all court costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharges to be taken out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for zero days.

chargeModifiers.descr: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School
PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Arroyo-Lopez

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order faxed to:  (715) 333-2708, and mailed to:  Black River Correctional Center, Attn:  Amended JOC, W6898 East Staffon Road, Black River Falls, WI  54615

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order- ERP, signed and filed.  

IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision.  The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by Department of Corrections Records Office staff member and will be based upon actual release date. 

IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect the defendant's release within 6 working days upon receipt of this order.
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 35, Judge Rosa.  jm
records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order mailed to MATTHEW GERBER BLACK RIVER CORRECTIONAL CENTER W6898 E STAFFON RD BLACK RIVER FALLS WI 54615
Defendant's petition for sentence adjustment on count one returned because he has not served the applicable percentage of confinement on this count.

Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, filed and signed by the Court.  The judgment of conviction shall be amended to state that the defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving two and a half years of total confinement time in this case.  Copies forwarded to the Court.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to clarify eligibility for early release programs.
Decision and Order DENYING Motion To Vacate DNA Surcharges received, signed, and filed with court.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion to vacate DNA surcharges (based on Cherry decision).
Amended information amending the amount of cocaine in Count 1 from >15-40 grams to >5-15 grams was filed on 4-24-14.

Defendant David Arroyo-Lopez in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant David Arroyo-Lopez in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Barthalomew.  COUNT 1:    Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 6 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 96 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
 
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

  - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 of initial confinement in each count.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

COUNT 2:  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
 
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

  - Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 of initial confinement in each count.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant David Arroyo-Lopez in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant David Arroyo-Lopez in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Barthalomew.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-12-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Awni M. Yasin in court, defendant David Arroyo-Lopez not in court, in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant David Arroyo-Lopez in court with attorney Awni Yasin.  Defendant David Arroyo-Lopez in custody.  Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Sworn as interpreter:Enrique Barbosa.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Louis Santana-Delgado (co-defendant).

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant David Arroyo-Lopez in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant David Arroyo-Lopez in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter:  Christina Green  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
